meta.content: Front Page; New York and Region
meta.name: online_sections

block.p: Japanese Leader Dies Keizo Obuchi, who as Japan's prime minister brought some stability to its economy and politics, died at age 62. He was relieved of his duties in April after a stroke.
Japanese Leader Dies Keizo Obuchi, who as Japan's prime minister brought some stability to its economy and politics, died at age 62. He was relieved of his duties in April after a stroke.
Some U.N. Soldiers Freed The United Nations said 18 peacekeepers among more than 500 held by Sierra Leone rebels had been freed. An unconfirmed report said 139 more had been released.

Knicks Tie Series, 2-2 Charlie Ward led the Knicks to a 91-83 victory over the Miami Heat in their N.B.A. playoff series. The Phoenix Suns defeated the Los Angeles Lakers and the Utah Jazz beat the Portland Trail Blazers to avert four-game sweeps.
Angry Palestinian Protests Thousands of Palestinians in the West Bank and Gaza held protests over the issues of prisoners and refugees. There were violent confrontations with Israeli troops.
A Word From the Governor Gov. George E. Pataki has become one of the most visible pitchmen of the airwaves, starring in television advertisements that have cost taxpayers about $20 million.
